clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Safety and Efficacy of Coronary Drug-coated Balloon (DCB) Combined With Spot Stenting of Drug-eluting Stent (DES) Versus Second-generation DES for Treating Diffuse Coronary Artery Lesions: a Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Safety and Efficacy of Coronary Drug-coated Balloon (DCB) Combined With Spot Stenting of Drug-eluting Stent (DES) Versus Second-generation DES for Treating Diffuse Coronary Artery Lesions: a Prospective, Randomized, Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The prospective, randomized, controlled clinical trial aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of paclitaxel-eluting PTCA-balloon catheter (SeQuent® Please) combined with provisional spot stenting of DES versus DES for treating diffuse coronary artery lesions concerning interventional therapy and vessel patency.

primary_outcome.description: Late lumen loss (LLL) in the lesion segment within 9 months after surgery

secondary_outcome.description: including device success rate, lesion success rate and clinical success rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Restenosis rate (RR) in the lesion segment
secondary_outcome.description: Restenosis rate (RR) in the lesion segment on 9 months after operation
Clinically-driven target lesion revascularization (CD-TLR) at 30 days and 3, 6, 9, 12, 24 and 36 months postoperatively
including cardiac death, target vessel myocardial infarction, and clinically-driven target lesion revascularization (CD-TLR), called target lesion failure (TLF) for short
including all-cause mortality, all myocardial infarctions, and any revascularization
